newsitem.title: UK: FORECAST - China says '96 growth could exceed 9 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - China says '96 growth could exceed 9 pct.

text.p: China's economic growth could exceed nine percent this year while inflation should be seven to eight percent, deputy governor of the People's Bank of China Chen Yuan said.
"Our target for economic growth in 1996 is eight percent but it could exceed nine percent," he said in a speech prepared for delivery at a seminar arranged by the Bank of England.
In the first half of this year gross domestic product rose 9.8 percent.
"Inflation should be within the range of seven to eight percent," Chen added.
Year-on-year inflation was 7.1 percent in the first half of the year and 14.8 percent in all of 1995.
Because of China's size it was inevitable that there would be hitches in the process of reform and that the authorities would need to adjust the pace.
"But there is no question that China is firmly resolved to continuing with the economic reform," Chen said.
